description: Elementary German vocabulary - practical words for travel, work, and daily life in Berlin

travel.name: Travel & Directions
travel.description: Essential vocabulary for getting around Berlin

words.example: Der Flughafen Berlin Brandenburg ist sehr modern.
words.exampleTranslation: Berlin Brandenburg Airport is very modern.
words.mnemonic: 'Flug' = flight + 'Hafen' = harbor - a harbor for flights!

words.exampleTranslation: We'll meet at the main train station.

words.example: Die Haltestelle ist um die Ecke.
words.exampleTranslation: The stop is around the corner.
words.mnemonic: 'Halten' = to stop + 'Stelle' = place - a stopping place!

words.example: Ich brauche eine Fahrkarte nach M√ºnchen.
words.exampleTranslation: I need a ticket to Munich.
words.mnemonic: 'Fahren' = to travel + 'Karte' = card - a travel card!

words.example: Der Eingang ist auf der anderen Seite.
words.exampleTranslation: The entrance is on the other side.
The museum is on the right.

words.example: Das Cafe ist an der Ecke.
words.exampleTranslation: The cafe is at the corner.
Do you have a city map?
My luggage is at the hotel.

transport.name: Public Transport
transport.description: Getting around Berlin with U-Bahn, S-Bahn, and buses

words.example: Mit der S-Bahn sind es 20 Minuten.

words.exampleTranslation: You have to transfer at Alexanderplatz.
words.mnemonic: 'Um' = around + 'steigen' = to climb - climb onto another!

words.example: Der Fahrplan h√§ngt an der Wand.
words.exampleTranslation: The schedule is hanging on the wall.

words.example: Der Zug f√§hrt von Gleis 7 ab.
words.mnemonic: Think of train 'gliding' on the track!

words.example: K√∂nnen Sie mir ein Taxi rufen?
words.exampleTranslation: Can you call me a taxi?

words.example: Berlin ist eine tolle Stadt zum Fahrradfahren.
words.exampleTranslation: Berlin is a great city for cycling.

words.example: Ich gehe zu Fu√ü zur Arbeit.

work.name: Work & Research
work.description: Professional vocabulary for offices and research

words.example: Mein B√ºro ist im dritten Stock.
words.exampleTranslation: My office is on the third floor.

words.example: Wir haben um 14 Uhr eine Besprechung.
words.exampleTranslation: We have a meeting at 2 PM.

words.example: Die Humboldt-Universit√§t ist in Berlin Mitte.
words.exampleTranslation: Humboldt University is in Berlin Mitte.

words.example: Ich habe morgen einen wichtigen Termin.
words.exampleTranslation: I have an important appointment tomorrow.
The laboratory is in the basement.

restaurant.name: Restaurant & Cafe
restaurant.description: Ordering food and drinks in Berlin

words.exampleTranslation: I would like to order, please.

words.example: Das Trinkgeld ist im Preis inbegriffen.
words.exampleTranslation: The tip is included in the price.
The main course comes with salad.

words.mnemonic: Think of 'cellar' - someone from the wine cellar!

accommodation.name: Hotel & Accommodation
accommodation.description: Staying in Berlin - hotels, hostels, apartments

words.mnemonic: Think of 'timber' room with wooden walls!

words.example: Ich habe eine Reservierung auf den Namen Schmidt.
words.exampleTranslation: I have a reservation under the name Schmidt.

words.mnemonic: Think of 'schloss' (castle) - you need a key!
'Fr√ºh' = early + 'St√ºck' = piece - early piece of food!

words.exampleTranslation: The elevator is on the right.

shopping.name: Shopping
shopping.description: Buying things in Berlin stores and markets

words.mnemonic: Where business ('Gesch√§ft' also means business) happens!

words.example: Der Supermarkt ist um die Ecke.
words.exampleTranslation: The supermarket is around the corner.

words.example: Die n√§chste Apotheke ist am Bahnhof.
words.exampleTranslation: The nearest pharmacy is at the station.
Berlin is getting more and more expensive.
I have to go to the doctor.

words.example: Das Krankenhaus ist in der N√§he.
Ich habe eine Allergie gegen N√ºsse.
words.exampleTranslation: I have an allergy to nuts.

words.example: Das Brandenburger Tor ist eine ber√ºhmte Sehensw√ºrdigkeit.
words.exampleTranslation: The Brandenburg Gate is a famous attraction.

words.example: Der Tiergarten ist ein gro√üer Park.
words.exampleTranslation: The Tiergarten is a big park.

words.mnemonic: Sounds like 'brook' - bridges go over brooks!

words.exampleTranslation: The TV Tower is very tall.

words.example: Das Rote Rathaus ist das Berliner Rathaus.
words.exampleTranslation: The Red City Hall is Berlin's city hall.

words.example: Die Spree ist ein Fluss durch Berlin.
words.exampleTranslation: The Spree is a river through Berlin.
We would like to visit the old town.

words.example: Wir gehen heute Abend ins Konzert.
words.exampleTranslation: We're going to the concert tonight.

words.example: Die Ausstellung im Museum ist interessant.
words.exampleTranslation: The exhibition at the museum is interesting.

words.example: Ich gehe dreimal pro Woche ins Fitnessstudio.
words.exampleTranslation: I go to the gym three times a week.

words.example: Im Sommer gehe ich oft schwimmen.
words.exampleTranslation: In summer I often go swimming.

words.example: Ich jogge jeden Morgen im Park.
words.exampleTranslation: I jog every morning in the park.

words.example: Fu√üball ist sehr beliebt in Deutschland.
words.exampleTranslation: Soccer is very popular in Germany.

words.exampleTranslation: The swimming pool is full in summer.

I have to download the file.

words.example: Vergiss nicht, die Datei zu speichern.
words.exampleTranslation: Don't forget to save the file.
I'm searching for information on the internet.

feelings.name: Feelings & Emotions
feelings.description: Expressing emotions and states of mind

words.example: Ich bin so aufgeregt vor der Reise!
words.exampleTranslation: I'm so excited about the trip!
She is sad about the news.

words.example: Er ist w√ºtend auf seinen Bruder.
words.exampleTranslation: He is angry at his brother.
words.mnemonic: When angry, you want to 'w√ºt' = scream!

words.example: Ich bin nerv√∂s vor der Pr√ºfung.
Am Wochenende bin ich sehr entspannt.
words.exampleTranslation: On the weekend I'm very relaxed.

words.example: Ich bin mit meiner Arbeit zufrieden.

words.exampleTranslation: She was disappointed about the result.

words.example: Die Eltern sind stolz auf ihre Kinder.
words.exampleTranslation: The parents are proud of their children.

words.example: Ich freue mich auf deinen Besuch.
words.exampleTranslation: I'm looking forward to your visit.

words.example: Ich m√∂chte dich zum Abendessen einladen.
words.exampleTranslation: I'd like to invite you for dinner.

words.example: Wollen wir uns f√ºr Samstag verabreden?
words.exampleTranslation: Shall we make plans for Saturday?

words.example: Wir machen eine Party am Wochenende.
words.exampleTranslation: We're having a party on the weekend.
Do you want to go eat together?

words.example: Ich wohne allein in meiner Wohnung.
words.exampleTranslation: I live alone in my apartment.
I shower cold in the morning.
I have to clean the apartment.

words.example: Ich wasche meine Kleidung am Wochenende.
words.exampleTranslation: I wash my clothes on the weekend.

words.example: Das Schlafzimmer hat ein gro√ües Fenster.
words.exampleTranslation: The bedroom has a big window.

words.exampleTranslation: The rent is very high in Berlin.

words.exampleTranslation: There's a bank on the corner.
